entries.title: MOTD2 analysis: How 'outstanding' Arsenal overcame 'difficult' Man Utd test
entries.description: Match of the Day 2's Mark Chapman and Martin Keown analyse Arsenal's 'outstanding' 3-2 Premier League victory over Manchester United.

entries.title: Ex-women's rugby boss says colleague made rape comment
entries.description: Women say they considered suicide because of a "toxic culture" of sexism at the Welsh Rugby Union.

entries.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Portuguese forward makes winning start with Al Nassr
entries.description: Watch as Cristiano Ronaldo makes his competitive debut for new club Al Nassr in their 1-0 win over Ettifaq in the Saudi Pro League on Sunday.

entries.title: Arsenal 3-2 Man Utd: 'Echoes of Wenger's title-winners' - Martin Keown analysis
entries.description: MOTD2 pundit Martin Keown senses the same belief and desire at Arsenal as when he won Premier League titles with the club.

entries.title: Nadhim Zahawi paid penalty as part of HMRC tax dispute
entries.description: The Conservative Party chairman is under pressure over his taxes, after saying he made a "careless error".

entries.title: Lisa Marie Presley: Daughter's emotional tribute read out at memorial
entries.description: On her behalf, Priscilla Presley read the tribute at a memorial service for her daughter Lisa Marie Presley.

entries.title: Freddie Burns: Leicester Tigers fly-half to join Super Rugby side Highlanders
entries.description: Freddie Burns, Leicester's match-winner in last season's Premiership final, will leave the club in February to join New Zealand-based Highlanders.

entries.title: NFL play-offs: Damar Hamlin attends Buffalo Bills play-off game just 20 days after cardiac arrest
entries.description: Damar Hamlin attends the Buffalo Bills' play-off game against the Cincinnati Bengals, just 20 days after he suffered a cardiac arrest.

entries.title: More than Ronaldo & matching Salah - Haaland's hat-trick heroics
entries.description: Some records have already been broken, others beckon. In the aftermath of his latest goalscoring feat, BBC Sport celebrates the phenomenon that is Erling Haaland.

entries.title: European Champions Cup: Edinburgh 20-14 Saracens
entries.description: A late try by Ben Earl secures a top-four place and a home tie for Saracens against Ospreys in the last 16 of the Champions Cup, despite suffering defeat in Edinburgh.

entries.title: National Grid puts coal plants on standby to supply electricity
entries.description: National Grid ESO orders coal-fire units to begin warming up as the UK's cold snap continues.

entries.title: Arsenal 3-2 Manchester United: Mikel Arteta says his side showed 'emotional control' in 'beautiful' victory
entries.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says his side showed "emotional control" in their "beautiful" 3-2 victory over Manchester United in the Premier League.

entries.title: Arsenal 3-2 Manchester United: Late goal by Eddie Nketiah gives Arsenal win over United
entries.description: Arsenal retain control of the Premier League title race after Eddie Nketiah's 90th-minute winner gives them a dramatic victory over Manchester United.

entries.title: Scottish Cup last 16: Holders Rangers host Thistle in last 16 & Celtic welcome St Mirren
entries.description: Holders Rangers will host Championship side Partick Thistle in the last 16 of the Scottish Cup.

entries.title: Australian Open 2023: Novak Djokovic continues bid for 10th title against Alex de Minaur
entries.description: Novak Djokovic continues his bid for a record-extending 10th Australian Open title against home favourite Alex de Minaur on day eight.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Resilient civilians return to liberated town of Lyman
entries.description: Ukrainian civilians are returning to Lyman, close to the front line, despite the threat of strikes.

entries.title: Strikes Update: How Monday 23 January’s walkouts will affect you
entries.description: What you need to know about the ambulance workers' strike, by the BBC's Zoe Conway.

entries.title: Hibernian 0-3 Hearts: Clinical Hearts extend run to dump Hibs out of cup
entries.description: Hearts' unbeaten Edinburgh derby run stretches to nine games as goals as they dump Hibernian out of the Scottish Cup in the fourth round.

entries.title: Reading 0-1 Manchester United: Rachel Williams winner puts visitors top of Women's Super League
entries.description: Rachel Williams scores a superb solo goal to beat Reading and send Manchester United top of the Women’s Super League.

entries.title: Newcastle: St Mary's Cathedral lockdown gathering claims to be reviewed
entries.description: The Catholic Safeguarding Standards Agency review is being supported by the Archbishop of Liverpool.

entries.title: Manchester City 3-0 Wolverhampton Wanderers: Erling Haaland scores hat-trick as City close gap on Arsenal
entries.description: Erling Haaland scores his fourth Manchester City hat-trick and takes his tally for the season to 31 in all competitions as relegation-threated Wolves are swept aside.

entries.title: Former UK PM Boris Johnson makes trip to Ukraine
entries.description: The former prime minister says it is a "privilege" to visit the country once more.

entries.title: Jacinda Ardern abuse 'abhorrent', says incoming NZ PM Chris Hipkins
entries.description: Chris Hipkins vows to protect his family from the treatment his predecessor, Jacinda Ardern, received.

entries.title: Two people dead in eight-vehicle crash on M40 in Buckinghamshire
entries.description: National Highways says the southbound carriageway will be closed for a "considerable time".

entries.title: First woman pastor in Holy Land ordained
entries.description: Palestinian Sally Azar became the region's first female church leader at an event in Jerusalem.

entries.title: Chelsea v Liverpool abandoned: Emma Hayes wants WSL to be 'taken more seriously'
entries.description: The Chelsea manager criticises the decision to kick off the game against Liverpool, which was quickly abandoned due to a frozen pitch.

entries.title: 'Get it all out now' over tax affairs, Zahawi urged
entries.description: Nadhim Zahawi should release "the absolute facts" on his taxes, ex-Tory party leader Sir Iain Duncan Smith says.

entries.title: WSL: Hope Powell brands Chelsea-Liverpool abandonment 'embarrassing'
entries.description: Former England head coach Hope Powell says it is "very embarrassing" that Chelsea and Liverpool's Women's Super League match was abandoned after six minutes because of a frozen pitch.

entries.title: Firms may be hiking prices beyond inflation - Tesco boss
entries.description: Food suppliers may be using inflation as excuse to raise prices further than necessary, John Allan says.

entries.title: Australian Open 2023: Why does tennis finish so late? And what's the impact on players?
entries.description: After Andy Murray called his 4am Australian Open finish a "farce", BBC Sport looks at why tennis matches finish so late and how it impacts the players.

entries.title: Leeds hospital terror suspect to be held for longer - police
entries.description: It follows a suspected firearm and suspicious package being found at St James's Hospital in Leeds.

entries.title: Wolves sign defender Craig Dawson from West Ham for £3.3m
entries.description: Wolves complete the signing of defender Craig Dawson from West Ham for £3.3m.

entries.title: Monterey Park: Several people shot near Los Angeles - reports
entries.description: The incident happened in an area where thousands had earlier gathered for a Lunar New Year event.

entries.title: Crackdown on energy firms over rise in prepayment meters
entries.description: Many customers have been left without heat and light when not able to afford topping up their prepayment meters.

entries.title: Liam Smith: Briton ready to accept Chris Eubank Jr rematch but open to Kell Brook fight
entries.description: Liverpool's Liam Smith says he is willing to fight Chris Eubank Jr again but is also intrigued by a bout with Kell Brook.

entries.title: Fight Talk: Conor Benn and Chris Eubank Sr react to Liam Smith's knockout of Chris Eubank Jr
entries.description: In this week's Fight Talk, the boxing world reacts to Liam Smith becoming the first man to stop Chris Eubank Jr.

entries.title: Australian Open 2023 results: Iga Swiatek loses to Elena Rybakina, Coco Gauff out to Jelena Ostapenko
entries.description: World number one Iga Swiatek loses to Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina in the Australian Open fourth round, with Coco Gauff also out.

entries.title: NFL divisional round play-offs: Hobbled Mahomes leads Chiefs over Jaguars, Eagles dominate Giants
entries.description: Patrick Mahomes battles ankle injury as the Kansas City Chiefs beat the Jacksonville Jaguars while the Philadelphia Eagles dominate the New York Giants.

entries.title: Actor Jeremy Renner broke over 30 bones in snow plough accident
entries.description: The Avengers star shares an update on his recovery after being critically injured on New Year's Day.

entries.title: Brazil Congress riots: President Lula sacks army commander
entries.description: General Julio Cesar de Arruda is the latest person in the military to lose their position.

entries.title: Census 2021: 'It took me two years before I realised I was a carer'
entries.description: Why have the number of unpaid carers dropped, according to the 2021 census?

entries.title: Motion capture tech from Avatar films used in disease research
entries.description: Motion capture suits used to create alien characters can track the onset of diseases of movement, researchers say.

entries.title: US files: Six more classified documents seized at Biden home
entries.description: For a third time, investigators find more files during a 13-hour search of the US president's home.

entries.title: Al-Shabab: US air strike in Somalia 'kills 30 militants'
entries.description: The US military says it helped government troops fighting al-Shabab Islamists northeast of the Somali capital.

entries.title: The Papers: King's 'coronation treat' and Zahawi tax 'error'
entries.description: Sunday's front pages reveal details of King Charles's coronation and report the Tory chairman is battling to save his career.

entries.title: Lunar New Year: Chinese families meet for bittersweet reunions
entries.description: China greets the Lunar New Year with hopes of returning to normality - but also grief and loss.

entries.title: Ukraine war: Hiding from Putin's call up by living off-grid in a freezing forest
entries.description: Adam Kalinin has been camping in the Russian wilderness since September to avoid fighting in Ukraine.

entries.title: MOTD analysis: How 'struggling' & 'defensive' Everton lost to West Ham
entries.description: Match of the Day pundits Jermaine Jenas and Danny Murphy analyse Everton's "defensive" performance in their 2-0 Premier League defeat at West Ham.

entries.title: Liam Smith beats Chris Eubank Jr via fourth-round stoppage
entries.description: Liam Smith stops Chris Eubank Jr in four rounds to win their middleweight fight in Manchester.
